title: Handle ADTs with implicit lifetime params resulting a lifetime mismatch in fn definition

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-papercut
labels.description: Diagnostic error that needs small tweaks

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

body:
I have this function:

```rust
use git2::Reference;
fn resolve_symbolic_reference(&self, reference: Option<Reference>) -> Option<Reference> {
    return reference;
    // here's more logic, this is just shortened for clarity
}
```

[Here's the source](https://github.com/alexcrichton/git2-rs/blob/master/src/reference.rs#L22) of the struct.

And I get this from compiler:

```
error[E0308]: mismatched types
  --> src/backend.rs:71:16
   |
71 |         return reference;
   |                ^^^^^^^^^ lifetime mismatch
   |
   = note: expected type `std::option::Option<git2::Reference<'_>>`
              found type `std::option::Option<git2::Reference<'_>>`
note: the anonymous lifetime #2 defined on the body at 70:92...
  --> src/backend.rs:70:93
   |
70 |     fn resolve_symbolic_reference(&self, reference: Option<Reference>) -> Option<Reference> {
   |                                                                                             ^
note: ...does not necessarily outlive the anonymous lifetime #1 defined on the body at 70:92
  --> src/backend.rs:70:93
   |
70 |     fn resolve_symbolic_reference(&self, reference: Option<Reference>) -> Option<Reference> {
   |                                                                                             ^

error: aborting due to previous error
```

First of all: I don't understand what's wrong with my code: isn't the lifetime of the function argument problem of the caller of my function?
Second: the compiler's error message is not helpful, especially:

```
   = note: expected type `std::option::Option<git2::Reference<'_>>`
              found type `std::option::Option<git2::Reference<'_>>`
```

I run rust unstable installed via rustup:
```
$ rustc 1.17.0-nightly (0aeb9c129 2017-03-15)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 0aeb9c12979e6da753701a798d04105b6b1a8c28
commit-date: 2017-03-15
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.17.0-nightly
LLVM version: 3.9
```

I have also reported this to [the library's upstream](https://github.com/alexcrichton/git2-rs/issues/197).
